description: A json schema for the VS Code Debug Protocol
title: VS Code Debug Protocol

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'setExceptionBreakpoints' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

_88Breakpoint.description: Information about a Breakpoint created in setBreakpoints or setFunctionBreakpoints.

___verified.description: If true breakpoint could be set (but not necessarily at the desired location).

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___column.description: An optional start column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___message.description: An optional message about the state of the breakpoint. This is shown to the user and can be used to explain why a breakpoint could not be verified.

___line.description: The start line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint. If no end line is given, then the end column is assumed to be in the start line.

___id.description: An optional unique identifier for the breakpoint.

$eref.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___source.description: The source where the breakpoint is located.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'pause' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

_88ChecksumAlgorithm.description: Names of checksum algorithms that may be supported by a debug adapter.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'initialized' event type.
This event indicates that the debug adapter is ready to accept configuration requests (e.g. SetBreakpointsRequest, SetExceptionBreakpointsRequest).
A debug adapter is expected to send this event when it is ready to accept configuration requests (but not before the InitializeRequest has finished).
The sequence of events/requests is as follows:
- adapters sends InitializedEvent (after the InitializeRequest has returned)
- frontend sends zero or more SetBreakpointsRequest
- frontend sends one SetFunctionBreakpointsRequest
- frontend sends a SetExceptionBreakpointsRequest if one or more exceptionBreakpointFilters have been defined (or if supportsConfigurationDoneRequest is not defined or false)
- frontend sends other future configuration requests
- frontend sends one ConfigurationDoneRequest to indicate the end of the configuration

_88CompletionItem.description: CompletionItems are the suggestions returned from the CompletionsRequest.

___text.description: If text is not falsy then it is inserted instead of the label.

$eref.description: Some predefined types for the CompletionItem. Please note that not all clients have specific icons for all of them.

___type.description: The item's type. Typically the client uses this information to render the item in the UI with an icon.

___start.description:
When a completion is selected it replaces 'length' characters starting at 'start' in the text passed to the CompletionsRequest.
If missing the frontend will try to determine these values heuristically.

___label.description: The label of this completion item. By default this is also the text that is inserted when selecting this completion.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

$eref.description: A Thread

_88ColumnDescriptor.description:
A ColumnDescriptor specifies what module attribute to show in a column of the ModulesView, how to format it, and what the column's label should be.
It is only used if the underlying UI actually supports this level of customization.

___attributeName.description: Name of the attribute rendered in this column.

___format.description: Format to use for the rendered values in this column. TBD how the format strings looks like.

___type.description: Datatype of values in this column.  Defaults to 'string' if not specified.

___width.description: Width of this column in characters (hint only).

_88DisconnectArguments.description:
Arguments for 'disconnect' request.
The disconnect request has no standardized attributes.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___type.description: The type of the new value. Typically shown in the UI when hovering over the value.

___variablesReference.description: If variablesReference is > 0, the new value is structured and its children can be retrieved by passing variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___value.description: The new value of the variable.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___variablesReference.description: The reference of the variable container.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
StepOut request; value of command field is 'stepOut'.
The request starts the debuggee to run again for one step.
The debug adapter first sends the StepOutResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'step') after the step has completed.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'stepOut' request.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
StepIn request; value of command field is 'stepIn'.
The request starts the debuggee to step into a function/method if possible.
If it cannot step into a target, 'stepIn' behaves like 'next'.
The debug adapter first sends the StepInResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'step') after the step has completed.
If there are multiple function/method calls (or other targets) on the source line,
the optional argument 'targetId' can be used to control into which target the 'stepIn' should occur.
The list of possible targets for a given source line can be retrieved via the 'stepInTargets' request.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'stepIn' request.

___targetId.description: Optional id of the target to step into.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
StepInTargets request; value of command field is 'stepInTargets'.
This request retrieves the possible stepIn targets for the specified stack frame.
These targets can be used in the 'stepIn' request.
The StepInTargets may only be called if the 'supportsStepInTargetsRequest' capability exists and is true.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'stepInTargets' request.

___frameId.description: The stack frame for which to retrieve the possible stepIn targets.
Retrieve the scopes for this stackframe.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'stepBack' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___args.description: List of arguments. The first argument is the command to run.

___kind.description: What kind of terminal to launch.

___env.description: Environment key-value pairs that are added to the default environment.

___frameId.description: The stack frame for which to retrieve the possible stepIn targets.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'launch' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___frameId.description: Evaluate the expression in the scope of this stack frame. If not specified, the expression is evaluated in the global scope.

___context.description: The context in which the evaluate request is run. Possible values are 'watch' if evaluate is run in a watch, 'repl' if run from the REPL console, or 'hover' if run from a data hover.

$eref.description: Base class of requests, responses, and events.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

_88ModulesViewDescriptor.description:
The ModulesViewDescriptor is the container for all declarative configuration options of a ModuleView.
For now it only specifies the columns to be shown in the modules view.

$eref.description:
A ColumnDescriptor specifies what module attribute to show in a column of the ModulesView, how to format it, and what the column's label should be.
It is only used if the underlying UI actually supports this level of customization.

___attributeName.description: Name of the attribute rendered in this column.

___format.description: Format to use for the rendered values in this column. TBD how the format strings looks like.

___type.description: Datatype of values in this column.  Defaults to 'string' if not specified.

___width.description: Width of this column in characters (hint only).

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'exited' event type.
The event indicates that the debuggee has exited.

___exitCode.description: The exit code returned from the debuggee.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___allThreadsContinued.description: If true, the continue request has ignored the specified thread and continued all threads instead. If this attribute is missing a value of 'true' is assumed for backward compatibility.

___targetId.description: The location where the debuggee will continue to run.

___threadId.description: Set the goto target for this thread.

_88Capabilities.description: Information about the capabilities of a debug adapter.

___supportsConfigurationDoneRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the configurationDoneRequest.

___supportsEvaluateForHovers.description: The debug adapter supports a (side effect free) evaluate request for data hovers.

___supportsSetVariable.description: The debug adapter supports setting a variable to a value.

___additionalModuleColumns.description: The set of additional module information exposed by the debug adapter.

$eref.description:
A ColumnDescriptor specifies what module attribute to show in a column of the ModulesView, how to format it, and what the column's label should be.
It is only used if the underlying UI actually supports this level of customization.

___attributeName.description: Name of the attribute rendered in this column.

___format.description: Format to use for the rendered values in this column. TBD how the format strings looks like.

___type.description: Datatype of values in this column.  Defaults to 'string' if not specified.

___width.description: Width of this column in characters (hint only).

___supportsHitConditionalBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports breakpoints that break execution after a specified number of hits.

___supportsRestartFrame.description: The debug adapter supports restarting a frame.

___supportsModulesRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the modules request.

___exceptionBreakpointFilters.description: Available filters for the setExceptionBreakpoints request.

$eref.description: An ExceptionBreakpointsFilter is shown in the UI as an option for configuring how exceptions are dealt with.

___filter.description: The internal ID of the filter. This value is passed to the setExceptionBreakpoints request.

___default.description: Initial value of the filter. If not specified a value 'false' is assumed.

___label.description: The name of the filter. This will be shown in the UI.

___supportsConditionalBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports conditional breakpoints.

___supportsFunctionBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports function breakpoints.

___supportsStepInTargetsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the stepInTargetsRequest.

___supportedChecksumAlgorithms.description: Checksum algorithms supported by the debug adapter.

$eref.description: Names of checksum algorithms that may be supported by a debug adapter.

___supportsGotoTargetsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the gotoTargetsRequest.

___supportsStepBack.description: The debug adapter supports stepping back.

___supportsCompletionsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the completionsRequest.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'output' event type.
The event indicates that the target has produced output.

___category.description: The category of output (such as: 'console', 'stdout', 'stderr', 'telemetry'). If not specified, 'console' is assumed.

___data.description: Optional data to report. For the 'telemetry' category the data will be sent to telemetry, for the other categories the data is shown in JSON format.

___moduleCount.description: The number of modules to return. If moduleCount is not specified or 0, all modules are returned.

___startModule.description: The index of the first module to return; if omitted modules start at 0.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___mimeType.description: Optional content type (mime type) of the source.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___variables.description: All (or a range) of variables for the given variable reference.

$eref.description:
A Variable is a name/value pair.
Optionally a variable can have a 'type' that is shown if space permits or when hovering over the variable's name.
An optional 'kind' is used to render additional properties of the variable, e.g. different icons can be used to indicate that a variable is public or private.
If the value is structured (has children), a handle is provided to retrieve the children with the VariablesRequest.
If the number of named or indexed children is large, the numbers should be returned via the optional 'namedVariables' and 'indexedVariables' attributes.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___type.description: The type of the variable's value. Typically shown in the UI when hovering over the value.

___variablesReference.description: If variablesReference is > 0, the variable is structured and its children can be retrieved by passing variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___value.description: The variable's value. For structured objects this can be a multi line text, e.g. for a function the body of a function.

___kind.description: Properties of a variable that can be used to determine how to render the variable in the UI. Format of the string value: TBD.

___evaluateName.description: Optional evaluatable name of this variable which can be passed to the 'EvaluateRequest' to fetch the variable's value.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___levels.description: The maximum number of frames to return. If levels is not specified or 0, all frames are returned.

___threadId.description: Retrieve the stacktrace for this thread.

___startFrame.description: The index of the first frame to return; if omitted frames start at 0.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description:
Response to 'setBreakpoints' request.
Returned is information about each breakpoint created by this request.
This includes the actual code location and whether the breakpoint could be verified.
The breakpoints returned are in the same order as the elements of the 'breakpoints'
(or the deprecated 'lines') in the SetBreakpointsArguments.

___breakpoints.description: Information about the breakpoints. The array elements are in the same order as the elements of the 'breakpoints' (or the deprecated 'lines') in the SetBreakpointsArguments.

$eref.description: Information about a Breakpoint created in setBreakpoints or setFunctionBreakpoints.

___verified.description: If true breakpoint could be set (but not necessarily at the desired location).

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___column.description: An optional start column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___message.description: An optional message about the state of the breakpoint. This is shown to the user and can be used to explain why a breakpoint could not be verified.

___line.description: The start line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint. If no end line is given, then the end column is assumed to be in the start line.

___id.description: An optional unique identifier for the breakpoint.

___source.description: The source where the breakpoint is located.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'stepOut' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Scopes request; value of command field is 'scopes'.
The request returns the variable scopes for a given stackframe ID.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'scopes' request.

___frameId.description: Retrieve the scopes for this stackframe.

_88Checksum.description: The checksum of an item calculated by the specified algorithm.

$eref.description: Names of checksum algorithms that may be supported by a debug adapter.

___algorithm.description: The algorithm used to calculate this checksum.

_88Module.description:
A Module object represents a row in the modules view.
Two attributes are mandatory: an id identifies a module in the modules view and is used in a ModuleEvent for identifying a module for adding, updating or deleting.
The name is used to minimally render the module in the UI.

Additional attributes can be added to the module. They will show up in the module View if they have a corresponding ColumnDescriptor.

To avoid an unnecessary proliferation of additional attributes with similar semantics but different names
we recommend to re-use attributes from the 'recommended' list below first, and only introduce new attributes if nothing appropriate could be found.

___addressRange.description: Address range covered by this module.

___symbolStatus.description: User understandable description of if symbols were found for the module (ex: 'Symbols Loaded', 'Symbols not found', etc.

___isUserCode.description: True if the module is considered 'user code' by a debugger that supports 'Just My Code'.

___symbolFilePath.description: Logical full path to the symbol file. The exact definition is implementation defined.

___isOptimized.description: True if the module is optimized.

___path.description:
optional but recommended attributes.
always try to use these first before introducing additional attributes.

Logical full path to the module. The exact definition is implementation defined, but usually this would be a full path to the on-disk file for the module.

_88Source.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

$eref.description: The checksum of an item calculated by the specified algorithm.

___algorithm.description: The algorithm used to calculate this checksum.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'next' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
SetBreakpoints request; value of command field is 'setBreakpoints'.
Sets multiple breakpoints for a single source and clears all previous breakpoints in that source.
To clear all breakpoint for a source, specify an empty array.
When a breakpoint is hit, a StoppedEvent (event type 'breakpoint') is generated.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'setBreakpoints' request.

___breakpoints.description: The code locations of the breakpoints.

___sourceModified.description: A value of true indicates that the underlying source has been modified which results in new breakpoint locations.

___source.description: The source location of the breakpoints; either source.path or source.reference must be specified.

___lines.description: Deprecated: The code locations of the breakpoints.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
runInTerminal request; value of command field is 'runInTerminal'.
With this request a debug adapter can run a command in a terminal.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'runInTerminal' request.

___args.description: List of arguments. The first argument is the command to run.

___kind.description: What kind of terminal to launch.

___env.description: Environment key-value pairs that are added to the default environment.

___noDebug.description: If noDebug is true the launch request should launch the program without enabling debugging.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___type.description: The optional type of the evaluate result.

___variablesReference.description: If variablesReference is > 0, the evaluate result is structured and its children can be retrieved by passing variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___result.description: The result of the evaluate request.

$eref.description: Base class of requests, responses, and events.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'thread' event type.
The event indicates that a thread has started or exited.

___reason.description: The reason for the event (such as: 'started', 'exited').

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
ConfigurationDone request; value of command field is 'configurationDone'.
The client of the debug protocol must send this request at the end of the sequence of configuration requests (which was started by the InitializedEvent).

$eref.description:
Arguments for 'configurationDone' request.
The configurationDone request has no standardized attributes.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: Initialize request; value of command field is 'initialize'.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'initialize' request.

___pathFormat.description: Determines in what format paths are specified. Possible values are 'path' or 'uri'. The default is 'path', which is the native format.

___columnsStartAt1.description: If true all column numbers are 1-based (default).

___adapterID.description: The ID of the debugger adapter. Used to select or verify debugger adapter.

___supportsVariablePaging.description: Client supports the paging of variables.

___supportsVariableType.description: Client supports the optional type attribute for variables.

___linesStartAt1.description: If true all line numbers are 1-based (default).

_88Variable.description:
A Variable is a name/value pair.
Optionally a variable can have a 'type' that is shown if space permits or when hovering over the variable's name.
An optional 'kind' is used to render additional properties of the variable, e.g. different icons can be used to indicate that a variable is public or private.
If the value is structured (has children), a handle is provided to retrieve the children with the VariablesRequest.
If the number of named or indexed children is large, the numbers should be returned via the optional 'namedVariables' and 'indexedVariables' attributes.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___type.description: The type of the variable's value. Typically shown in the UI when hovering over the value.

___variablesReference.description: If variablesReference is > 0, the variable is structured and its children can be retrieved by passing variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___value.description: The variable's value. For structured objects this can be a multi line text, e.g. for a function the body of a function.

___kind.description: Properties of a variable that can be used to determine how to render the variable in the UI. Format of the string value: TBD.

___evaluateName.description: Optional evaluatable name of this variable which can be passed to the 'EvaluateRequest' to fetch the variable's value.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed child variables.
The client can use this optional information to present the children in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: Attach request; value of command field is 'attach'.

$eref.description:
Arguments for 'attach' request.
The attach request has no standardized attributes.

___breakpoints.description: The function names of the breakpoints.

$eref.description: Properties of a breakpoint passed to the setFunctionBreakpoints request.

___hitCondition.description: An optional expression that controls how many hits of the breakpoint are ignored. The backend is expected to interpret the expression as needed.

___condition.description: An optional expression for conditional breakpoints.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
setVariable request; value of command field is 'setVariable'.
Set the variable with the given name in the variable container to a new value.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'setVariable' request.

___variablesReference.description: The reference of the variable container.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___targetId.description: Optional id of the target to step into.

_88ExceptionBreakpointsFilter.description: An ExceptionBreakpointsFilter is shown in the UI as an option for configuring how exceptions are dealt with.

___filter.description: The internal ID of the filter. This value is passed to the setExceptionBreakpoints request.

___default.description: Initial value of the filter. If not specified a value 'false' is assumed.

___label.description: The name of the filter. This will be shown in the UI.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___targets.description: The possible goto targets of the specified location.

$eref.description:
A GotoTarget describes a code location that can be used as a target in the 'goto' request.
The possible goto targets can be determined via the 'gotoTargets' request.

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the range covered by the goto target.

___column.description: An optional column of the goto target.

___line.description: The line of the goto target.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the range covered by the goto target.

___id.description: Unique identifier for a goto target. This is used in the goto request.

___label.description: The name of the goto target (shown in the UI).

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: Disconnect request; value of command field is 'disconnect'.

$eref.description:
Arguments for 'disconnect' request.
The disconnect request has no standardized attributes.

_88StepInTarget.description: A StepInTarget can be used in the 'stepIn' request and determines into which single target the stepIn request should step.

___id.description: Unique identifier for a stepIn target.

___label.description: The name of the stepIn target (shown in the UI).

_88ProtocolMessage.description: Base class of requests, responses, and events.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Pause request; value of command field is 'pause'.
The request suspenses the debuggee.
The debug adapter first sends the PauseResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'pause') after the thread has been paused successfully.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'pause' request.

___pathFormat.description: Determines in what format paths are specified. Possible values are 'path' or 'uri'. The default is 'path', which is the native format.

___columnsStartAt1.description: If true all column numbers are 1-based (default).

___adapterID.description: The ID of the debugger adapter. Used to select or verify debugger adapter.

___supportsVariablePaging.description: Client supports the paging of variables.

___supportsVariableType.description: Client supports the optional type attribute for variables.

___linesStartAt1.description: If true all line numbers are 1-based (default).

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: StackTrace request; value of command field is 'stackTrace'. The request returns a stacktrace from the current execution state.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'stackTrace' request.

___levels.description: The maximum number of frames to return. If levels is not specified or 0, all frames are returned.

___threadId.description: Retrieve the stacktrace for this thread.

___startFrame.description: The index of the first frame to return; if omitted frames start at 0.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: Modules can be retrieved from the debug adapter with the ModulesRequest which can either return all modules or a range of modules to support paging.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'modules' request.

___moduleCount.description: The number of modules to return. If moduleCount is not specified or 0, all modules are returned.

___startModule.description: The index of the first module to return; if omitted modules start at 0.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'goto' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

_88StackFrame.description: A Stackframe contains the source location.

___name.description: The name of the stack frame, typically a method name.

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the range covered by the stack frame.

___moduleId.description: The module associated with this frame, if any.

___column.description: The column within the line. If source is null or doesn't exist, column is 0 and must be ignored.

___line.description: The line within the file of the frame. If source is null or doesn't exist, line is 0 and must be ignored.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the range covered by the stack frame.

___id.description: An identifier for the stack frame. It must be unique across all threads. This id can be used to retrieve the scopes of the frame with the 'scopesRequest' or to restart the execution of a stackframe.

$eref.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___source.description: The optional source of the frame.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'stopped' event type.
The event indicates that the execution of the debuggee has stopped due to some condition.
This can be caused by a break point previously set, a stepping action has completed, by executing a debugger statement etc.

___text.description: Additional information. E.g. if reason is 'exception', text contains the exception name. This string is shown in the UI.

___reason.description: The reason for the event (such as: 'step', 'breakpoint', 'exception', 'pause'). This string is shown in the UI.

___allThreadsStopped.description:
If allThreadsStopped is true, a debug adapter can announce that all threads have stopped.
*  The client should use this information to enable that all threads can be expanded to access their stacktraces.
*  If the attribute is missing or false, only the thread with the given threadId can be expanded.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
GotoTargets request; value of command field is 'gotoTargets'.
This request retrieves the possible goto targets for the specified source location.
These targets can be used in the 'goto' request.
The GotoTargets request may only be called if the 'supportsGotoTargetsRequest' capability exists and is true.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'gotoTargets' request.

___column.description: An optional column location for which the goto targets are determined.

___line.description: The line location for which the goto targets are determined.

___source.description: The source location for which the goto targets are determined.

_88AttachRequestArguments.description:
Arguments for 'attach' request.
The attach request has no standardized attributes.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

$eref.description: CompletionItems are the suggestions returned from the CompletionsRequest.

___text.description: If text is not falsy then it is inserted instead of the label.

___type.description: The item's type. Typically the client uses this information to render the item in the UI with an icon.

___start.description:
When a completion is selected it replaces 'length' characters starting at 'start' in the text passed to the CompletionsRequest.
If missing the frontend will try to determine these values heuristically.

___label.description: The label of this completion item. By default this is also the text that is inserted when selecting this completion.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description: Launch request; value of command field is 'launch'.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'launch' request.

___noDebug.description: If noDebug is true the launch request should launch the program without enabling debugging.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___scopes.description: The scopes of the stackframe. If the array has length zero, there are no scopes available.

$eref.description: A Scope is a named container for variables. Optionally a scope can map to a source or a range within a source.

___name.description: Name of the scope such as 'Arguments', 'Locals'.

___expensive.description: If true, the number of variables in this scope is large or expensive to retrieve.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named variables in this scope.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___endLine.description: Optional end line of the range covered by this scope.

___column.description: Optional start column of the range covered by this scope.

___variablesReference.description: The variables of this scope can be retrieved by passing the value of variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___line.description: Optional start line of the range covered by this scope.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed variables in this scope.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___endColumn.description: Optional end column of the range covered by this scope.

___breakpoints.description: The code locations of the breakpoints.

$eref.description: Properties of a breakpoint passed to the setBreakpoints request.

___hitCondition.description: An optional expression that controls how many hits of the breakpoint are ignored. The backend is expected to interpret the expression as needed.

___column.description: An optional source column of the breakpoint.

___condition.description: An optional expression for conditional breakpoints.

___line.description: The source line of the breakpoint.

___sourceModified.description: A value of true indicates that the underlying source has been modified which results in new breakpoint locations.

$eref.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___source.description: The source location of the breakpoints; either source.path or source.reference must be specified.

___lines.description: Deprecated: The code locations of the breakpoints.

_88FunctionBreakpoint.description: Properties of a breakpoint passed to the setFunctionBreakpoints request.

___hitCondition.description: An optional expression that controls how many hits of the breakpoint are ignored. The backend is expected to interpret the expression as needed.

___condition.description: An optional expression for conditional breakpoints.

_88GotoTarget.description:
A GotoTarget describes a code location that can be used as a target in the 'goto' request.
The possible goto targets can be determined via the 'gotoTargets' request.

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the range covered by the goto target.

___column.description: An optional column of the goto target.

___line.description: The line of the goto target.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the range covered by the goto target.

___id.description: Unique identifier for a goto target. This is used in the goto request.

___label.description: The name of the goto target (shown in the UI).

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Variables request; value of command field is 'variables'.
Retrieves all child variables for the given variable reference.
An optional filter can be used to limit the fetched children to either named or indexed children.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'variables' request.

___count.description: The number of variables to return. If count is missing or 0, all variables are returned.

___start.description: The index of the first variable to return; if omitted children start at 0.

___filter.description: Optional filter to limit the child variables to either named or indexed. If ommited, both types are fetched.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Source request; value of command field is 'source'.
The request retrieves the source code for a given source reference.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'source' request.

___sourceReference.description: The reference to the source. This is the value received in Source.reference.

___count.description: The number of variables to return. If count is missing or 0, all variables are returned.

___start.description: The index of the first variable to return; if omitted children start at 0.

___filter.description: Optional filter to limit the child variables to either named or indexed. If ommited, both types are fetched.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Thread request; value of command field is 'threads'.
The request retrieves a list of all threads.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'breakpoint' event type.
The event indicates that some information about a breakpoint has changed.

$eref.description: Information about a Breakpoint created in setBreakpoints or setFunctionBreakpoints.

___verified.description: If true breakpoint could be set (but not necessarily at the desired location).

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___column.description: An optional start column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___message.description: An optional message about the state of the breakpoint. This is shown to the user and can be used to explain why a breakpoint could not be verified.

___line.description: The start line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint. If no end line is given, then the end column is assumed to be in the start line.

___id.description: An optional unique identifier for the breakpoint.

___source.description: The source where the breakpoint is located.

___reason.description: The reason for the event (such as: 'changed', 'new').

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'restartFrame' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'attach' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
CompletionsRequest request; value of command field is 'completions'.
Returns a list of possible completions for a given caret position and text.
The CompletionsRequest may only be called if the 'supportsCompletionsRequest' capability exists and is true.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'completions' request.

___text.description: One or more source lines. Typically this is the text a user has typed into the debug console before he asked for completion.

___column.description: The character position for which to determine the completion proposals.

___frameId.description: Returns completions in the scope of this stack frame. If not specified, the completions are returned for the global scope.

___line.description: An optional line for which to determine the completion proposals. If missing the first line of the text is assumed.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'stepIn' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___text.description: One or more source lines. Typically this is the text a user has typed into the debug console before he asked for completion.

___column.description: The character position for which to determine the completion proposals.

___frameId.description: Returns completions in the scope of this stack frame. If not specified, the completions are returned for the global scope.

___line.description: An optional line for which to determine the completion proposals. If missing the first line of the text is assumed.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
StepBack request; value of command field is 'stepBack'.
The request starts the debuggee to run one step backwards.
The debug adapter first sends the StepBackResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'step') after the step has completed.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'stepBack' request.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___totalFrames.description: The total number of frames available.

___stackFrames.description:
The frames of the stackframe. If the array has length zero, there are no stackframes available.
This means that there is no location information available.

$eref.description: A Stackframe contains the source location.

___name.description: The name of the stack frame, typically a method name.

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the range covered by the stack frame.

___moduleId.description: The module associated with this frame, if any.

___column.description: The column within the line. If source is null or doesn't exist, column is 0 and must be ignored.

___line.description: The line within the file of the frame. If source is null or doesn't exist, line is 0 and must be ignored.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the range covered by the stack frame.

___id.description: An identifier for the stack frame. It must be unique across all threads. This id can be used to retrieve the scopes of the frame with the 'scopesRequest' or to restart the execution of a stackframe.

___source.description: The optional source of the frame.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
SetExceptionBreakpoints request; value of command field is 'setExceptionBreakpoints'.
Enable that the debuggee stops on exceptions with a StoppedEvent (event type 'exception').

$eref.description: Arguments for 'setExceptionBreakpoints' request.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'disconnect' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: On error that is whenever 'success' is false, the body can provide more details.

$eref.description: A structured message object. Used to return errors from requests.

___format.description:
A format string for the message. Embedded variables have the form '{name}'.
If variable name starts with an underscore character, the variable does not contain user data (PII) and can be safely used for telemetry purposes.

___url.description: An optional url where additional information about this message can be found.

___urlLabel.description: An optional label that is presented to the user as the UI for opening the url.

___variables.description: An object used as a dictionary for looking up the variables in the format string.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___targets.description: The possible stepIn targets of the specified source location.

$eref.description: A StepInTarget can be used in the 'stepIn' request and determines into which single target the stepIn request should step.

___id.description: Unique identifier for a stepIn target.

___label.description: The name of the stepIn target (shown in the UI).

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

$eref.description: Information about the capabilities of a debug adapter.

___supportsConfigurationDoneRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the configurationDoneRequest.

___supportsEvaluateForHovers.description: The debug adapter supports a (side effect free) evaluate request for data hovers.

___supportsSetVariable.description: The debug adapter supports setting a variable to a value.

___additionalModuleColumns.description: The set of additional module information exposed by the debug adapter.

___supportsHitConditionalBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports breakpoints that break execution after a specified number of hits.

___supportsRestartFrame.description: The debug adapter supports restarting a frame.

___supportsModulesRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the modules request.

___exceptionBreakpointFilters.description: Available filters for the setExceptionBreakpoints request.

___supportsConditionalBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports conditional breakpoints.

___supportsFunctionBreakpoints.description: The debug adapter supports function breakpoints.

___supportsStepInTargetsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the stepInTargetsRequest.

___supportedChecksumAlgorithms.description: Checksum algorithms supported by the debug adapter.

___supportsGotoTargetsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the gotoTargetsRequest.

___supportsStepBack.description: The debug adapter supports stepping back.

___supportsCompletionsRequest.description: The debug adapter supports the completionsRequest.

___body.description: The capabilities of this debug adapter.

___column.description: An optional column location for which the goto targets are determined.

___line.description: The line location for which the goto targets are determined.

$eref.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___source.description: The source location for which the goto targets are determined.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Goto request; value of command field is 'goto'.
The request sets the location where the debuggee will continue to run.
This makes it possible to skip the execution of code or to executed code again.
The code between the current location and the goto target is not executed but skipped.
The debug adapter first sends the GotoResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'goto').

$eref.description: Arguments for 'goto' request.

___targetId.description: The location where the debuggee will continue to run.

___threadId.description: Set the goto target for this thread.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

___modules.description: All modules or range of modules.

$eref.description:
A Module object represents a row in the modules view.
Two attributes are mandatory: an id identifies a module in the modules view and is used in a ModuleEvent for identifying a module for adding, updating or deleting.
The name is used to minimally render the module in the UI.

Additional attributes can be added to the module. They will show up in the module View if they have a corresponding ColumnDescriptor.

To avoid an unnecessary proliferation of additional attributes with similar semantics but different names
we recommend to re-use attributes from the 'recommended' list below first, and only introduce new attributes if nothing appropriate could be found.

___addressRange.description: Address range covered by this module.

___symbolStatus.description: User understandable description of if symbols were found for the module (ex: 'Symbols Loaded', 'Symbols not found', etc.

___isUserCode.description: True if the module is considered 'user code' by a debugger that supports 'Just My Code'.

___symbolFilePath.description: Logical full path to the symbol file. The exact definition is implementation defined.

___isOptimized.description: True if the module is optimized.

___path.description:
optional but recommended attributes.
always try to use these first before introducing additional attributes.

Logical full path to the module. The exact definition is implementation defined, but usually this would be a full path to the on-disk file for the module.

___totalModules.description: The total number of modules available.

_88Scope.description: A Scope is a named container for variables. Optionally a scope can map to a source or a range within a source.

___name.description: Name of the scope such as 'Arguments', 'Locals'.

___expensive.description: If true, the number of variables in this scope is large or expensive to retrieve.

___namedVariables.description:
The number of named variables in this scope.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___endLine.description: Optional end line of the range covered by this scope.

___column.description: Optional start column of the range covered by this scope.

___variablesReference.description: The variables of this scope can be retrieved by passing the value of variablesReference to the VariablesRequest.

___line.description: Optional start line of the range covered by this scope.

___indexedVariables.description:
The number of indexed variables in this scope.
The client can use this optional information to present the variables in a paged UI and fetch them in chunks.

___endColumn.description: Optional end column of the range covered by this scope.

$eref.description: A Source is a descriptor for source code. It is returned from the debug adapter as part of a StackFrame and it is used by clients when specifying breakpoints.

___name.description: The short name of the source. Every source returned from the debug adapter has a name. When specifying a source to the debug adapter this name is optional.

___origin.description: The (optional) origin of this source: possible values 'internal module', 'inlined content from source map', etc.

___checksums.description: The checksums associated with this file.

___adapterData.description: Optional data that a debug adapter might want to loop through the client. The client should leave the data intact and persist it across sessions. The client should not interpret the data.

___path.description: The long (absolute) path of the source. It is not guaranteed that the source exists at this location.

___sourceReference.description: If sourceReference > 0 the contents of the source can be retrieved through the SourceRequest. A sourceReference is only valid for a session, so it must not be used to persist a source.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'continued' event type.
The event indicates that the execution of the debuggee has continued.
Please note: a debug adapter is not expected to send this event in response to a request that implies that execution continues, e.g. 'launch' or 'continue'.
It is only necessary to send a ContinuedEvent if there was no previous request that implied this.

___allThreadsContinued.description: If allThreadsContinued is true, a debug adapter can announce that all threads have continued.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description: Response to 'configurationDone' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

___sourceReference.description: The reference to the source. This is the value received in Source.reference.

_88ConfigurationDoneArguments.description:
Arguments for 'configurationDone' request.
The configurationDone request has no standardized attributes.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Continue request; value of command field is 'continue'.
The request starts the debuggee to run again.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'continue' request.

___threadId.description: Continue execution for the specified thread (if possible). If the backend cannot continue on a single thread but will continue on all threads, it should set the allThreadsContinued attribute in the response to true.

_88CompletionItemType.description: Some predefined types for the CompletionItem. Please note that not all clients have specific icons for all of them.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Next request; value of command field is 'next'.
The request starts the debuggee to run again for one step.
The debug adapter first sends the NextResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'step') after the step has completed.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'next' request.

_88SourceBreakpoint.description: Properties of a breakpoint passed to the setBreakpoints request.

___hitCondition.description: An optional expression that controls how many hits of the breakpoint are ignored. The backend is expected to interpret the expression as needed.

___column.description: An optional source column of the breakpoint.

___condition.description: An optional expression for conditional breakpoints.

___line.description: The source line of the breakpoint.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
SetFunctionBreakpoints request; value of command field is 'setFunctionBreakpoints'.
Sets multiple function breakpoints and clears all previous function breakpoints.
To clear all function breakpoint, specify an empty array.
When a function breakpoint is hit, a StoppedEvent (event type 'function breakpoint') is generated.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'setFunctionBreakpoints' request.

___breakpoints.description: The function names of the breakpoints.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'terminated' event types.
The event indicates that debugging of the debuggee has terminated.

___restart.description: A debug adapter may set 'restart' to true to request that the front end restarts the session.

$eref.description: Base class of requests, responses, and events.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

___body.description: Contains request result if success is true and optional error details if success is false.

___message.description: Contains error message if success == false.

___request_seq.description: Sequence number of the corresponding request.

allOf.description:
Response to 'setFunctionBreakpoints' request.
Returned is information about each breakpoint created by this request.

___breakpoints.description: Information about the breakpoints. The array elements correspond to the elements of the 'breakpoints' array.

$eref.description: Information about a Breakpoint created in setBreakpoints or setFunctionBreakpoints.

___verified.description: If true breakpoint could be set (but not necessarily at the desired location).

___endLine.description: An optional end line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___column.description: An optional start column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___message.description: An optional message about the state of the breakpoint. This is shown to the user and can be used to explain why a breakpoint could not be verified.

___line.description: The start line of the actual range covered by the breakpoint.

___endColumn.description: An optional end column of the actual range covered by the breakpoint. If no end line is given, then the end column is assumed to be in the start line.

___id.description: An optional unique identifier for the breakpoint.

___source.description: The source where the breakpoint is located.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
Evaluate request; value of command field is 'evaluate'.
Evaluates the given expression in the context of the top most stack frame.
The expression has access to any variables and arguments that are in scope.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'evaluate' request.

___frameId.description: Evaluate the expression in the scope of this stack frame. If not specified, the expression is evaluated in the global scope.

___context.description: The context in which the evaluate request is run. Possible values are 'watch' if evaluate is run in a watch, 'repl' if run from the REPL console, or 'hover' if run from a data hover.

_88Message.description: A structured message object. Used to return errors from requests.

___format.description:
A format string for the message. Embedded variables have the form '{name}'.
If variable name starts with an underscore character, the variable does not contain user data (PII) and can be safely used for telemetry purposes.

___url.description: An optional url where additional information about this message can be found.

___urlLabel.description: An optional label that is presented to the user as the UI for opening the url.

___variables.description: An object used as a dictionary for looking up the variables in the format string.

___body.description: Event-specific information.

allOf.description:
Event message for 'module' event type.
The event indicates that some information about a module has changed.

$eref.description:
A Module object represents a row in the modules view.
Two attributes are mandatory: an id identifies a module in the modules view and is used in a ModuleEvent for identifying a module for adding, updating or deleting.
The name is used to minimally render the module in the UI.

Additional attributes can be added to the module. They will show up in the module View if they have a corresponding ColumnDescriptor.

To avoid an unnecessary proliferation of additional attributes with similar semantics but different names
we recommend to re-use attributes from the 'recommended' list below first, and only introduce new attributes if nothing appropriate could be found.

___addressRange.description: Address range covered by this module.

___symbolStatus.description: User understandable description of if symbols were found for the module (ex: 'Symbols Loaded', 'Symbols not found', etc.

___isUserCode.description: True if the module is considered 'user code' by a debugger that supports 'Just My Code'.

___symbolFilePath.description: Logical full path to the symbol file. The exact definition is implementation defined.

___isOptimized.description: True if the module is optimized.

___path.description:
optional but recommended attributes.
always try to use these first before introducing additional attributes.

Logical full path to the module. The exact definition is implementation defined, but usually this would be a full path to the on-disk file for the module.

___module.description: The new, changed, or removed module. In case of 'removed' only the module id is used.

___threadId.description: Continue execution for the specified thread (if possible). If the backend cannot continue on a single thread but will continue on all threads, it should set the allThreadsContinued attribute in the response to true.

___arguments.description: Object containing arguments for the command.

allOf.description:
RestartFrame request; value of command field is 'restartFrame'.
The request restarts execution of the specified stackframe.
The debug adapter first sends the RestartFrameResponse and then a StoppedEvent (event type 'restart') after the restart has completed.

$eref.description: Arguments for 'restartFrame' request.
